thread.title: Mariners, Panthers, Windjammers net victories as season's end looms
thread.title_full: Mariners, Panthers, Windjammers net victories as season's end looms

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Mariners, Panthers, Windjammers net victories as season's end looms
text:
High school boys and girls soccer Mariners, Panthers, Windjammers net victories as season's end looms By Staff | Oct 16, 2015 
For some Midcoast high school soccer squads, the end of the regular season is in sight, while for others seasons are in the books. 
Several teams collected wins on Thursday, Oct. 15, including the Camden Hills boys and girls, the Oceanside boys and Medomak Valley boys (a separate story on the Camden Hills girls will appear soon). 
Photos from the Oceanside at Mount View boys, Mount Ararat at Camden Hills boys, Medomak Valley at Belfast girls and Morse at Medomak Valley girls games will appear later with this story. 
The following is a recap of reported results: 
Boys soccer 
Oceanside 4, Mount View 2 
At Thorndike Oct. 15, the Mariners took their first lead of the game in the second half and doubled up the host Mustangs. The squads were tied 1-1 at halftime. 
Leading the Oceanside offense were Christian Straka (2 goals), Titus Kaewthong (goal), Andrew King (goal, 2 assists) and Sam Townsend (assist). 
Brandon Reynolds and Mikey Hustus each creased the net in the losing effort for the hosts. 
Both squads attempted 15 shots, while Mount View held a 6-2 edge in corner kicks. 
Seth Davis made 11 saves in goal for the 'Stangs, while Coby Dorr made 13 saves in net for the Mariners. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Oceanside (9-2-2, 99.3622 points) is fourth. Ellsworth (10-1-1, 131.6582 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Medomak Valley 5, Belfast 1 
At Belfast Oct. 15, the Panthers surged past the Lions in the second half en route to their eighth win. Medomak Valley led 1-0 at halftime. 
Zach Starr, Cameron Leach, Alvaro Valls, Jackson Vail and Adam Eutsler creased the net in the win for the Panthers, while Rick Wyman scored for Belfast, off an assist by Sean Kennedy. 
Cameron Robinson made two saves on six shots in net for Medomak Valley, while Max Lewis made 11 saves on 21 shots in goal for Belfast. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Medomak Valley (8-3-2, 75.6122 points) is ninth, while Ellsworth (10-1-1, 131.6582 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Camden Hills 3, Mount Ararat 2 
At Rockport Oct. 16, the Windjammers sailed past the Eagles and netted a one-goal win. 
Josiah Krul scored two goals in the win for Camden Hills, while Kieran Lydon added a goal and an assist and Kyle Crans one assist. 
The names of the Mount Ararat scorers were unavailable. 
Lucas Boetsch made 13 saves on 19 shots in goal for Camden Hills, while Gavin Patterson made seven saves on 12 shots in net for the Eagles. 
The hosts held a 6-3 edge in corner kicks. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class A North, Camden Hills (10-2-2, 120.8163 points) is third, while Lewiston (13-0, 152.4490 points) is first in the 14-team region. The top 10 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Girls soccer 
Belfast 2, Medomak Valley 0 
At Belfast Oct. 15, the Lions avenged an earlier loss to the Panthers and prevailed via shutout. The game was scoreless at halftime. 
Lydia Violette and Ashley Flanders scored in the winning effort for the Lions. 
Chelsea Ripley minded the net for the Panthers and made one save, while Cori Shooter had the shutout in goal for the Lions, as she turned away four shots. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Medomak Valley (2-10-1, 16.4796 points) is 17th. Oceanside of Rockland/Thomaston (11-0-1, 149.2857 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Medomak Valley 0, Morse 0 (2 OTs) 
At Waldoboro Oct. 14, the Panthers and Shipbuilders settled for a scoreless stalemate. 
Chelsea Ripley made six saves in goal for Medomak Valley, while Marissa Parks played in net for Morse. 
Courier Publications' sports staff can be reached by email at sports@villagesoup.com or by phone at 594-4401.
